details.content: CLICK HERE FOR EARLIER UPDATES

details.title: Containment zones in Delhi brought down from 715 to 496, serosurvey extended
details.content:
• The containment zones have come down to 496 from 715 following a review
  • A second sero-prevalence survey kick-started on Saturday in the national capital 
  • The survey which was initially planned till August 5 has been extended till August 7 as many samples couldn't be collected due to the Eid holiday

details.title: Policemen in Assam who recovered from COVID donate blood plasma
details.content:
Guwahati: Assam Police in collaboration with State Health Dept & National Health Mission organised a plasma donation camp at Guwahati Medical College&Hospital, Auditorium, yesterday. 43 police personnel who recovered from #COVID19 donated their blood plasma at the camp. pic.twitter.com/F7vA0MCtRW

— ANI (@ANI) August 1, 2020

details.title: 738 new COVID-19 cases reported in Jharkhand
details.content:
738 new #COVID19 cases reported in Jharkhand today. Total number of cases rises to 12,104 including 7,477active cases, 4,513 recovered and discharged cases and 114 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/c9SWmArdzZ

— ANI (@ANI) August 1, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 vaccine scramble fear increases as 40 crore people will need it first
details.content: If vulnerable groups in India are to be the first beneficiaries of the COVID-19 vaccine, as enunciated by the government, a whopping 40 crore people, or 30% of India’s total population, will need the vaccine, prompting fears of a scramble, at least in the beginning. (READ MORE)

details.title: Madurai man booked for promising to ‘arrange’ Remdesivir
details.content: Acting on a complaint from the Tamil Nadu Branch of Indian Medical Association, the Drugs Control Department has registered a case against an Anna Nagar-based drug agent for promising to illegally arrange Remdesivir, a drug used in Covid treatment. (READ MORE)

details.title: Stricter curbs imposed on old age homes as COVID cases spike
details.content: After 130 persons of four old age homes in Ernakulam and Thiruvananthapuram tested positive for COVID-19, the state government has imosed in strict restrictions on facilities. While 95 people in three establishments tested positive in Ernakulam, 35 were infected at Kochuthura Santhibhavan in Thiruvananth-apuram. (READ MORE)

details.title: Not enough preparations made to fight COVID: Deve Gowda
details.content: Amid a surge in COVID cases in the state, political activities have gained momentum over the last few weeks. The ruling BJP has revamped its state unit, the Congress has become active under D K Shivakumar and former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda too has stepped up to reinvigorate his party. (READ MORE)

details.title: Still no drop in COVID cases, Karnataka tally now stands at 1.29 lakh
details.content: After horrid July that saw the COVID situation worsening, the first day of August too saw over 5,000 cases with the state reporting 5,172 positives, taking the tally to 1,29,287 positives on Saturday. (READ MORE)

details.title: After denied admission, differently-abled girl dies of COVID in Chikkamagaluru
details.content: A 20-year-old differently-abled girl died at the district hospital here on Saturday and was later tested positive for COVID-19. The victim was a final year B.Com student and a resident of Gowri Kaluve. (READ MORE)

details.title: Chennai bounces back: Recovery rate doubles in July
details.content: Crossing yet another grim milestone that would go down the annals of its’s confrontational chronicles with the coronavirus, Chennai surged past one lakh infections, with 1,074 new cases being reported on Saturday. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID scare spooks IISc students
details.content: Students at the Indian Institute of Science are worried about the COVID-19 outbreak on the campus. What is worrying more is that there is no clarity on the scale of the outbreak. (READ MORE)

details.title: Frontline warriors fighting govt’s COVID battle work with no pay
details.content: Working on the frontline to aid the state in its fight against the pandemic, they are as much at risk of contracting Covid-19 as any other health worker. Yet, over 600 medical students who chose the state’s government hospitals for the mandatory one-year house surgency are neither paid anything nor covered under the government’s free insurance coverage. (READ MORE)

details.title: Cab drivers in Pune say they're facing difficulties as inter-district movement remains restricted in Maharashtra
details.content:
Maharashtra: Cab drivers in Pune say they're facing difficulties as inter-district movement remains restricted in the state. One of them says,"I used to get at least 20 trips per month,now I get 1-2 one-sided trips. My low income makes it difficult to manage my expenses" #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/2sskACBvn5

— ANI (@ANI) August 1, 2020

details.title: Odisha government issues COVID-19 testing guidelines for private hospitals, labs
details.content: Odisha Government issued guidelines for all private hospitals, nursing homes and laboratories in the State, intending to start COVID-19 testing by Rapid Antigen and RT PCR method.

details.title: India's COVID tally crosses 17 lakh mark with 54,736 positive cases
details.content: Total COVID-19 cases stand at 17,50,724 including 5,67,730 active cases, 11,45,630 cured/discharged/migrated & 37,364 deaths: Health Ministry

details.content: According to the bulletin released on August 1, over 65.6 per cent of the total COVID-19 cases in the state are male patients, while women constitute only 34.4 per cent. (READ MORE)

details.title: Activists warn of sharp rise in human trafficking in near future
details.content: Tarannum (name changed) has many cut marks on her wrist, scars that constantly remind her of the several years she spent in a brothel where she was sexually exploited countless times. (READ MORE)

details.title: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah mocks at BJP's threat to sue him
details.content: Former Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday ridiculed the ruling BJP's threat to sue him for alleging Rs 2,000-crore corruption in coronavirus management in the state. (READ MORE)

details.title: A couple from Anantapuram District, who were under home isolation, died allegedly by suicide last night.
details.content: A couple from Anantapuram District, who were under home isolation, died allegedly by suicide last night. Dharmavaram DSP Ramakanth says, "They were found COVID-19 positive on July 25. Their treatment was complete. The reason for suicide not known yet."

details.title: Mutyala Raju, District Collector, West Godavari has ordered curfew in district today
details.content:
Andhra Pradesh: Mutyala Raju, District Collector, West Godavari has ordered curfew in the district today, in wake of COVID-19.

Police personnel makes an appeal to locals to continue cooperation with police in following curfew restrictions & norms to prevent spread of Coronavirus pic.twitter.com/XaOJTR2TMH

details.title: Telangana reports 1,891 new COVID-19 cases, 10 deaths
details.content: As many as 1,891 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths were reported in Telangana, taking the tally to 66,677 and the toll to 540, the state government said on Sunday.

details.title: 83 fresh COVID-19 cases in Arunachal; count rises to 1,673
details.content: Eighty-three more people, including 14 security personnel and seven healthcare workers, tested positive for COVID-19 in Arunachal Pradesh on Sunday, taking the state's tally to 1,673, an official said.

details.title: Tamil Nadu​​​​​​​ in total shutdown on Sunday
details.content: Tamil Nadu went on a total shutdown mode on Sunday with the government imposing intense curbs as part of its anti-coronavirus measures, leaving main roads deserted while most shops, barring pharmacies, remained closed.

details.title: Odisha's COVID-19 tally rises to 34,913 with 1,434 new cases, death toll mounts to 197
details.content: Odisha's coronavirus tally shot up to 34,913 on Sunday with 1,434 fresh cases, while 10 more fatalities pushed the death toll to 197, a health department official said.

details.title: One death takes toll to 52 in Puducherry; 200 COVID-19cases reported
details.content: The COVID-19 case tally in the Union Territory rose to 3,806 on Sunday with 200 people testing positive for the virus, while one death took the toll to 52.

details.title: Rajasthan recorded 561 new COVID-19 cases and 9 deaths today
details.content: Rajasthan recorded 561 new COVID-19 cases and 9 deaths today, taking total cases to 43,804 out of which 12,391 cases are active. A total of 30,710 patients have been discharged after treatment while 703 others have died so far: State Health Department

details.title: Kamala Rani Varun worked efficiently while being the part of the Cabinet: UP CM Adityanath
details.content: I express my deepest condolences to the family of Cabinet Minister Kamala Rani Varun. She was COVID-19 positive & was receiving treatment at SGPGI Hospital. She was a popular public leader & a social worker. She worked efficiently while being the part of the Cabinet: UP CM Adityanath

details.title: Over 54,000 COVID-19 cases in India in single day, total tally crosses 17 lakh
details.content:
This is the fourth consecutive day that COVID-19 cases have increased by more than 50,000 According to the ICMR, a cumulative total of 1,98,21,831 samples have been tested up to August 1 with, 463,172 samples being tested on Saturday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Soon a registry to collect real-time data?
details.content:
A registry of hospitalised COVID-19 patients across the country is being mooted to collect real time data which will help improve treatment outcomes, analyse trends in the progression of the pandemic and calibrate response: Officials
(Inputs from PTI)

Health workers wearing PPE during a joint cooperation effort between Israel and India, where rapid tests are being developed which will provide results in less than 30 seconds if successful, in New Delhi. (Photo | Shekhar Yadav, EPS)

details.title: Global updates | Hurricane Isaias nears COVID-hit Florida after lashing the Bahamas
details.content:
Coronavirus cases have surged in Florida in recent weeks, and the added menace of a storm ratcheted up the anxiety. State-run virus testing sites are closing in areas where the storm might hit because the sites are outdoor tents, which could topple in high winds.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: They are not alright! Scientists study coronavirus outbreaks among minks in Europe
details.content:
• Coronavirus outbreaks at mink farms in Spain and the Netherlands have scientists digging into how the animals got infected and if they can spread it to people
  • In the meantime, authorities have killed more than 1 million minks at breeding farms in both countries as a precaution
  • The virus that first infected people in China late last year came from an animal source, probably bats, and later spread from person to person, as other coronaviruses had done in the past

(Inputs from AP)
(File Photo | AP)

details.title: COVID-19 recovery rate rises to 65.44%, case fatality rate drops further to 2.13%
details.content:
With 51,225 patients cured and discharged in a day, India's total recoveries have surged to 11,45,629 and exceeded active cases of COVID-19 by 5,77,899 as on date, while the case fatality rate has further dropped to 2.13 per cent.

details.title: TN Governor Banwarilal Purohit tests positive for COVID-19
details.content:
Tamil Nadu Governor Banwarilal Purohit tested positive for COVID-19 in Chennai on Sunday. He is asymptomatic and clinically stable according to a hospital statement.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: In a series of developments on Sunday:
details.content:
• Tamil Nadu Governor Banwarilal Purohit tested positive for COVID-19 in Chennai. He is asymptomatic and clinically stable according to a statement issued by the hospital
  • Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday tested positive for the coronavirus. Taking to Twitter, 55-year-old Shah said that he has tested positive for coronavirus and is getting admitted to a hospital following the advice of doctors
  • Meanwhile, veteran Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan who had previously tested positive for coronavirus has now tested negative and has been discharged from the Nanavati Hospital in Mumbai
  • The chief of Uttar Pradesh's BJP unit, Swatantra Dev Singh, has tested positive for COVID-19 and has quarantined himself at his home as per doctors' advice.
  • Uttar Pradesh Cabinet Minister Kamal Rani Varun passed away at Lucknow’s SGPGI on Sunday. She had tested positive for coronavirus on July 18 and was being treated for the infection at the PGI’s COVID centre.

(Inputs from ENS)

details.title: '7 days paid institutional quarantine at their own cost, followed by 7 days isolation at home'

details.title: WATCH | Kerala bulletin

details.title: IPL 2020 final on November 10, Chinese sponsors intact, COVID-19 replacements allowed: Governing Council
details.content: The tournament will be played from September 19 to November 10 at three venues in the UAE -- Dubai, Sharjah and Abu Dhabi -- subject to government approval, which is expected in the next couple of days. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: COVID death toll reaches 322 in Bihar, tally climbs to 57,270 with 2,762 fresh cases
details.content: Of the 10 fresh casualties, three deaths were reported from Kaimur, two from Rohtas and one each from Patna, Buxar, Gaya, Saran and Supaul districts. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Now, Karnataka CM tests positive
details.content:
I have tested positive for #coronavirus. Whilst I am fine, I am being hospitalised as a precaution on the recommendation of doctors. I request those who have come in contact with me recently to be observant and exercise self-quarantine: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa pic.twitter.com/EOWMLtcgf7

— ANI (@ANI) August 2, 2020

details.title: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: The chief minister had home quarantined himself twice earlier after staff at his official residence had tested positive on two different occasions. The infection, CMO officials said, was detected during routine weekly tests conducted for the Chief Minister. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Assam reports four more COVID-19 deaths, 1,178 new cases take state's tally near 43,000 mark
details.content: The state reported 1,178 new cases out of 19,943 tests, with Kamrup Metropolitan district recording the highest of 268 infections. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Keep working hard: Kejriwal to authorties as Delhi reports 15 COVID-19 deaths, lowest in a month
details.content: According to authorities, the COVID-19 recovery rate in Delhi has increased to over 89 per cent, while the case positivity rate in the last 24 hours was 7.54 per cent. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: BCCI SOP: 60 plus Arun Lal can't coach Bengal, Baroda may miss Whatmore
details.content: "Individuals who are over the age of 60 years, viz support staff, umpires, ground staff and those indviduals with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, weakened immunity, should be considered vulnerable and are believed to have higher risk of severe COVID-19," read one of the guidelines from BCCI's 100-page SOP, which is in possession of PTI. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Body exhumed over COVID-19 suspicions in Bengaluru
details.content: A 41-year-old man’s body was exhumed on Sunday after the police suspected foul play in his death. The body has been sent for autopsy. The deceased, Sadananda, a resident of KG Bajuru, was active in politics and ran a water supply business. (READ MORE)

details.title: Mandatory institutional quarantine for international flyers lifted
details.content: "The travellers can also seek exemption from institutional quarantine by submitting a negative RT-PCR test report on arrival.This test sho uld have been conducted within 96 hours prior to undertaking the journey. The test report should be uploaded on the portal www. newdelhiairport.in for consideration," the guidelines stated.

details.title: Raksha Bandhan:  Raigarh Police to distribute masks
details.content: According to an official release, a mask is a foremost measure to safeguard against the infection and hence Raigarh police have organised a mega awareness campaign named "Ek Rakshasutra mask ka", on the occasion of Raksha Bandhan.

details.title: Yediyurappa clinically stable
details.content:
Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has been admitted to the hospital for observation. He is doing well, is clinically stable and will be monitored closely by our team: Manipal Hospital

Karnataka Chief Minister tested positive for COVID19 yesterday. (file pic) pic.twitter.com/s1OGKyjvGf

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

— ANI (@ANI) August 2, 2020

details.title: Global tally surpass 18 million-mark
details.content: As of Monday morning, the total number of cases stood at 18,002,567 and the fatalities rose to 687,930, revealed Johns Hopkins University. (READ HERE)

details.title: Yediyurappa's daughter tests positive
details.content: In a statement, Manipal Hospital in Bengaluru, where the Chief Minister is currently undergoing treatment, said that his daughter too had tested positive and has been shifted to the hospital on Monday. The chief minister's family members have gone into quarantine. (READ HERE)

details.title: UP official ends life after testing positive
details.content: In a shocking incident, a 52-year-old Block Education Officer (BEO), allegedly died by suicide in Kanpur after he tested positive for the novel coronavirus. According to the police, the family members took the victim, Suresh Chandra Verma, to the Ursula Horseman hospital here after he complained of fever and breathlessness on July 26.

details.title: 26 fresh cases in Arunachal
details.content: The northeastern state's total count now stands at 1,698, a senior health official said.

details.title: Karti Chidambaram tests positive
details.content:
I have just tested positive for #Covid. My symptoms are mild and as per medical advice I am under home quarantine. I would urge all those who have recently been in contact with me to follow medical protocol.

— Karti P Chidambaram (@KartiPC) August 3, 2020

details.title: Rajasthan update
details.content:
565 #COVID19 cases, 242 recovered & 9 deaths reported in Rajasthan today, as of 10:30 am. Total number of cases in the state is now at 44,975, including 12,802 active cases & 715 deaths: State Health Department pic.twitter.com/bwqXmUS7O0

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Indian workers stuck in Kuwait seek help
details.content: With the National Assembly of Kuwait approving the Expat Quota Bill that will lead to the repatriation of around eight lakh Indians from the Gulf nation, several migrant workers from Telangana and Andhra Pradesh have started raising their voices, demanding the Indian government to repatriate them back to the country. (READ HERE)

details.title: Karnataka govt urges people to get tested if they had met CM recently
details.content: "All those who met Chief Minister in the last 2-3 days will be tested for COVID-19. Chief Minister's travel history of last one week will be checked," said the state Health Department. Yediyurappa and his daughter have been admitted to the Manipal Hospital in Bengaluru for observation after testing positive for COVID-19. The Chief Minister is in a clinically stable condition.

details.title: Puducherry update
details.content:
Puducherry's #COVID19 case tally reaches 3,982 with 178 fresh positive cases detected today till 10am: Government of Puducherry pic.twitter.com/jW3qKQdC8u

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Odisha reports 1,384 new cases
details.content: The total number of COVID-19 cases in the state now stands at 36,297. The number of recovered cases is 21,954 and there are 14,095 active cases, said the I & PR Department.

details.title: Mizoram to treat infected security personnel, civilians at separate hospitals
details.content: Officials observed it was not "medically healthy" to treat infected security personnel and civilian patients at the same hospital, Health Minister Dr R Lalthangliana said.

details.title: 2,290 patients in Lucknow gave wrong personal info
details.content: The issue came to light when administration authorities tried to contact the patients to inform them about of their COVID-19 reports. The district administration has now sought the help of the surveillance division of the state police after which 1,171 people were traced and admitted to the hospital.

details.content:
One more #Covid_19 death in Kozhikode; Kakkattil native Marakkar Kutty (70) brought dead at Medical College Hospital today morning from a private hospital. He was tested positive at the private hospital. @xpresskerala @NewIndianXpress

— Amiya Meethal (@amiya_TNIE) August 3, 2020

Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) gives approval to Serum Institute of India, Pune to conduct Phase II+III clinical trials of Oxford University's Astra Zeneca #COVID19 vaccine (COVISHIELD) in India: Government of India

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Ravi Shankar Prashad goes under home quarantine
details.content: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, who had met Amit Shah on August 1, quarantined himself at home, reports said. Home Minister Amit Shah tested positive for COVID-19 on Sunday and has been admitted to Medanta Hospital in Gurugram.

details.title: Karnataka Governor tests negative for COVID-19
details.content: A day after Karnataka CM tested positive for COVID-19, Governor Governor Vajubhai said that he has tested negative for the virus.

details.title: Negligence led to spread of COVID-19, admits Kerala CM
details.content: With the state is dealing with a new wave of coronavirus cases, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that there was negligence on the part of all in fighting COVID-19. (READ MORE)

details.title: Guidelines issued for gyms to reopen from August 5
details.content:
Ministry of Home Affairs which allowed Yoga institutes and gymnasiums to re-open from August 5 has issued guidelines on preventive measures to contain the spread of COVID-19.@XpressBengaluru @santwana99 @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/ep5IDF1AJV

— PREEJA PRASAD (@preejap13) August 3, 2020

details.title: Two-thirds of migrants have returned to cities or wish to do so: Survey
details.content: Nearly two-thirds of migrant workers, who had left for home due to the coronavirus-induced lockdown, have either returned to cities or wish to do so in absence of skilled employment in villages, according to a new study that surveyed 4,835 households. (READ MORE)

details.title: Social distancing norms go for a toss at COVID-19 testing centre
details.content:
The scary new normal? People flout social distancing norms even when they wait to get tested for #COVID19 in Tirupati.
Express photos | @KanchiMadhav.@xpressandhra pic.twitter.com/EzJnQSejIG

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) August 3, 2020

details.title: Data shows substantial fall in requirement for ICU beds, ventilators
details.content: The number of active Covid-19 cases in India may be going up, but there has been a considerable fall in the requirement for ICU beds, ventilators and oxygen beds in the last two months, an analysis of the government data shows. (READ MORE)

details.title: Over 50,000 Indians repatriated from Oman since May
details.content: More than 50,000 Indians living in Oman have been flown home on repatriation and chartered flights in the last three months after the oil-rich Gulf nation was hit by the coronavirus outbreak, a media report said on Monday. (READ MORE)

details.title: WATCH| As cases decline, normalcy limps back in Chennai
details.content:
As recovery rate goes up and #COVID19 cases decline, Chennai inches close to normalcy. As Tamil Nadu government lifted restrictions, people enjoy lunch at a hotel in Mylapore.
Express video | @ddmallick.@xpresstn @shibasahu2012 pic.twitter.com/n9BHopzhEA

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) August 3, 2020

details.title: Six staff at Karnataka CM office hit COVID-19
details.content: Six employees at the Karnataka Chief Minister B S Yediyurappa's office have tested positive for COVID-19, official sources said on Monday. After the Chief Minister tested positive, his office and residence were sanitised. Besides, contact tracing was done during which the six of his staff members were confirmed to have contracted the virus, the sources said.

details.title: COVID-19 toll rises to 248 in Odisha as 12 more succumb
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in the state increased by 1,384 to 36,297 on Monday, even as 12 more people, including two females, succumbed to the disease taking the death toll to 248. (READ MORE)

details.title: SII gets nod for Oxford Covid-19 vaccine candidate’s human trials
details.content: The Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) has allowed the Serum Institute of India (SII) to conduct phase 2 and 3 human clinical trials of a potential Covid-19 vaccine developed by the Oxford University, UK, the Centre said on Monday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tamil Nadu records 109 COVID-19 deaths in a day, highest so far
details.content:
Tamil Nadu on Monday recorded 109 deaths and 5,609 fresh cases. However, the number of discharged person has crossed 2lakh-mark.

  • Fresh cases in Tamil Nadu: 5,609
  • Fresh cases in Chennai: 1021
  • Deaths recorded on Monday: 109
  • Total deaths recorded in Tamil Nadu: 4241
  • Active cases: 56,698
  • Samples tested in one day: 58,211

details.title: ATMs in Bengal running short of cash due to COVID-19 restrictions
details.content: Several ATMs in West Bengal are running short of currency as private entities entrusted with the cash-filling task are operating with skeletal staff, sources said on Monday. Many lenders have outsourced the exercise to such entities, who are responsible for the maintenance and operation of ATMs in the state, they said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala records 962 new cases
details.content:
#Kerala #Covid19 update
August 3

Contact transmission - 801

From abroad - 55

Health workers - 15@xpresskerala@NewIndianXpress@MSKiranPrakash

— Sovi Vidyadharan (@sovividyadharan) August 3, 2020

details.title: Spain's new wave of infections hits the young, middle-aged
details.content: Spain's government had ended a three-month lockdown after an COVID-19 onslaught that claimed at least 28,400 lives in the European Union nation. To kickstart its stalled economy, Spaniards were encouraged to cautiously resume their lives under a "new normality" based on wearing face masks, washing hands and social distancing. The respite didn't last long. (READ MORE)

details.title: Delhi records 805 positive cases in a day; 10000 tests conducted on Sunday
details.content:
Around 10K tests were conducted on Sunday of which 805 tested positive for #Covid_19
937 patients recovered.
17 more fatalities.
Active cases remain above 10K @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard #coronavirus pic.twitter.com/ewyFEWKOwT

— Somrita Ghosh (@Somrita_Ghosh) August 3, 2020

details.title: IIMB registers first COVID-19 case
details.content: Indian Institute of Management Bengaluru reported its first COVID-19 case. A member of the agency that handles outdoor horticulture work on campus tested positive for on Saturday. 50 primary contacts are in 14-days home quarantine and assured full pay, the officials said.

details.title: Bengal govt changes lockdown dates again
details.content: The lockdown dates in West Bengal were changed for the fifth time on Monday. Now lockdown will be observed on August 5, 8, 20, 21, 27, 28 and 31.

details.title: In Karnataka, DIMHANS offers phone therapy for COVID-19 patients at home
details.content: The Dharwad Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (DIMHANS) has come up with tele psychotherapy for COVID-19 patients who are getting treatment under home isolation. The facility is the first of its kind in the state. (READ MORE)

details.title: CPM politburo member tests COVID-19 positive
details.content: CPM politburo member and former Lok Sabha MP Md Salim has been admitted with COVID-19.

details.title: COVID-19: Daily toll hits new high of 109 in Tamil Nadu, 921 deaths in last 10 days
details.content: The comorbidity ratio also indicates that those with diabetes are more prone to succumb, while the majority of the deaths have been due to COVID pneumonia, viral pneumonia or viral pneumonitis, all of which refer to an infection in the lung. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: 84 new cases in Manipur
details.content:
Manipur reported 84 cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, taking total cases to 2,920 out of which 1,147 cases are active. Seven people have died in the state so far. Recovery rate stands at 60.47%: State government pic.twitter.com/v9izjXAvNw

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Latest guidelines for lockdown relaxation in Mumbai
details.content:
All govt offices (excl emergency, health & medical,
treasuries, disaster mgmt, police, NIC, food & civil supply, FCI, NYK, municipal services to function with 15% strength or 15 people whichever's more. Pvt offices can operate up to 10% strength or 10 people, whichever's more:BMC pic.twitter.com/8110zDCy04

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Latest guidelines for banks operating in Odisha
details.content:
Odisha govt allows normal functioning of public & private sector banks, RRBs, state co-operative banks & insurance companies with 50% staff in large branches & full strength in small branches with less than 5 employees till August 31, by following the COVID-19 guidelines. pic.twitter.com/fH2c4G4Kau

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Yediyurappa doing well: Hospital sources
details.content: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa was admitted on August 2 with mild symptoms of COVID-19. At present, he is doing well & is clinically stable. He is being treated and monitored closely by a multidisciplinary team of doctors: Manipal Hospitals.

details.title: News from Kerala
details.content: Kerala High Court extends ban on all protests in public places until August 31, in view of COVID-19 pandemic and the guidelines issued by the Union Government. On July 15, the Court had banned all public protests until July 31.

details.content:
Shivamogga: Congress leader R. Prasanna Kumar tests positive for #COVID19 after returning from Bengaluru. He had attended a party program at Bengaluru on July 27. He says, "I don't have symptoms. Those who came in contact with me should get tested." #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/y2ZlvHZI6F

— ANI (@ANI) August 3, 2020

details.title: Let school teachers assess number of children who need eggs amid lockdown: Madras High Court
details.content: After the state submitted that it was practically impossible to give eggs to children who are missing them due to the lockdown, the Madras High Court directed that it will issue detailed directions on Tuesday on providing them with dry rations. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Kerala changes its COVID-19 strategy
details.content:
• Containment Zones will now be defined after tracing primary and secondary contacts of a positive person.
  • These would not be spread across a ward or wide area but will be highly localised in and around residences of those identified during contact tracing.
  • Declaration of the Containment Zone will not be for a particular period but will continue until it is ensured that the primary and secondary contacts in the area are free from infection.
